title: Online accounts
content:
Well why don't we make this easy...

[url=http://pckf.keenx.com]pckf.keenx.com[/url]


Try it out. Search for "zach", see what you find. Hopefully it is pretty understandable.

I've only put a few of my accounts and a couple dummy entries in to show how it works.
Don't want this to get out of hand and fancy, but feel free to offer some suggestions if you like.

I will not put anyone's account in there unless they personally and specifically ask me to. If you want any of your accounts searchable, please tell me the account info you want listed. I need User Name and Messaging Service.
Hope everyone finds this useful! [img]http://www.classicgaming.com/cc314/msgboard/emotikeen-love.gif[/img]

title: Re: .
content:
There are two nifty features to this that Zach showed me which I find make the thing entirely usable (the first time I used it, I found it completely unintuitive and would've preferred a list).

1. Use the % wildcard. Just % will bring up everything in the list.
2. Search the PCKF username, select the (PCKF) result and click the button underneath to show the names associated with that user.

title: RE: .
content:
Exactly, Spleen.
I made this because sometimes in the middle of MSN chats, I can't figure out who I'm talking to. (Who they are on the PCKF.)

New stuff now... Pretty obvious if you check the site, but now you can manage your own user names.
To do this, I've created a login/password combination for each of you who have asked for your info to be listed. I will have to catch you on MSN or AIM to give you your password.

From this point forward, I'm not planning to manually enter usernames. Anyone else who want's an account on the list, just ask (here or on a chat service) and I'll set up a login for you.

title: Re: RE: .
content:
I'm 6764184 on ICQ, but I never really use that anymore, for no particular reason, other than that most other people I know/knew stopped coming online as well.
I'm "retodon8" on Live/MSN (standard hotmail.com), Yahoo!, and Google messengers, but again, I'm never really online with those, although checking Gmail puts me online for Google Talk of course.
(I don't use AOL/AIM or Jabber.)
Finally I'm "retodon8" on Xfire as well, the only messenger that's on these days.

Zach, feel free to add me to your database if you want.

It might be handy to have a pull-down to choose names from... although actually MSN/Y!/&c. names would be more useful than PCKF names, meaning a whole bunch of pulldowns, so maybe not after all. [img]http://www.classicgaming.com/cc314/msgboard/emotikeen-smile.gif[/img]

Hey, could you make the program list the messengers' popularities for PCKF members maybe?
I'm just curious how many users use the different messengers.

Oh, and is anybody familiar with Gabbly?
It's one of those programs that adds a chat to any website, similar to those programs that lets people vote for any website.
This one is Ajax though, so no install necesary, no need to create an account either.
I only just found it myself, but it seems to work quite nicely.
For instance check this link for [url=http://gabbly.com/www.pckf.com/]www.pckf.com[/url].
The little box (can also dock right or bottom) stays open while browsing through the forum, and seeing person X and Y are online, or maybe just were in the last 5 (?) minutes, but not being able to shout a quick "Hi!" has always been a tad annoying to me. [img]http://www.classicgaming.com/cc314/msgboard/emotikeen-smile.gif[/img] Retodon8
Sheep happens! [url=http://keen.retodon8.net/][img]http://retodon8.net/Keen/Graphics/K1_nme_Yorp.gif[/img][/url]

title: Re: m
content:
I suppose my Gmail account is automatically my Google Talk account, so I have one of those as well, although I don't have the messenger installed, just (pretty much don't at all) use the one integrated in the Gmail website.

Speaking of Google Talk, since it uses XMPP, Jabber's protocol, or at least a variation of it, is it compatible with Jabber's messenger in that two people not using the same program, but did choose from the two above, can converse?
I can't seem to find a definitive answer on this, and I don't know anyone using Jabber, so... quick almost off-topic question here. [img]http://www.classicgaming.com/cc314/msgboard/emotikeen-smile.gif[/img] Retodon8
Sheep happens! [url=http://keen.retodon8.net/][img]http://retodon8.net/Keen/Graphics/K1_nme_Yorp.gif[/img][/url]

title: Re: m
content: Yes, Google Talk is compatible with Jabber.  Google opened up their network and allowed connections to other Jabber networks a while back, so Google Talk will now interconnect with other Jabber users (like me!)  My Jabber ID is malvineous@shikadi.net.
